alert.note: Alert for Banks; Barrow; Cherokee; Clarke; Cobb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Madison; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 8:35AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cherokee, Barrow, Forsyth, northeastern Cobb, Gwinnett, southern Banks, northwestern Clarke, southern Hall, Jackson, northeastern Fulton and western Madison Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 834 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Lathemtown to near Aqualand Park to near Banks Crossing to 6 miles east of Homer, and moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Lawrenceville, Winder, Jefferson, Commerce, Cumming, Danielsville, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Milton, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Suwanee, Buford, Braselton, Auburn, Flowery Branch and Dacula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Banks; Barrow; Cherokee; Clarke; Cobb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Madison; North Fulton
